result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Backler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 31 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Fond du Lac County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($343) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victim (mother) or residence listed in the criminal complaint unless permission is given by the victim and with the Agent's approval.
Court will allow the defendant to reside with his grandfather in Fond Du Lac County if Agent deems appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas J Backler
Current: 309 Maple Avenue, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2016)
Prior: 515 W. Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Letter from court clerk to defendant advising the defendant that trustee and/or good time credit is given by the Sheriff's Department.
filed by defendant requesting good time and/or trustee credit.
Letter from Court to the defendant, denying his request for huber privileges and/or a sentence modification.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/1/15 requesting to work time off.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 9/25/15
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicholas J Backler in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
7 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
31 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
Court will allow for Transfer to Fond du Lac County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim (mother) or residence listed in the criminal complaint unless permission is given by the victim and with the agents approval
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Court will allow the Defendant to reside with his grandfather in Fond du Lac County as long as agent deems appropriate.

Costs:  $243
D.V. Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
